name: Our Blessings Early Learning Center Too
notes: Some students will be inside and some outside.
publicDescription: We need help getting our center ready for spring. This entails some light outdoor and indoor painting, cleaning, trash pickup, etc.
bio: Our Blessings Early Learning Center offers a comprehensive early education experience focused on academic, social, emotional, and physical development for children from birth through kindergarten. When we expose children to different environments and various learning experiences, we allow them to explore their self-awareness and gain a sense of the world around them. We need help getting things ready for the spring such as gardening, landscaping, painting, and archival office work.

name: Allegro Living
address: 4501 W Shannon Lakes Dr, Tallahassee, FL 32309
notes: Possibility of contact with leashed animals. some residents have pets, but they will always be on a leash. Resident enjoy students interacting with their animals.
publicDescription: We would like to create an activity for our residents that includes the wiping down and "cleaning" of their walkers and wheelchairs. We would also love to have volunteers wipe down surfaces in our common areas (chairs, tables, etc). And some closet organization would be super helpful as well!.
bio: Allegro Senior Living‚Äôs Tallahassee community is the area‚Äôs premier senior living community, offering multiple living options and floor plans to fit a variety of lifestyles and care needs. From helping with daily tasks like housekeeping and medication administration to exciting day trips around the local area and chef-prepared meals. We would like to create an activity for our residents that includes the wiping down and "cleaning" of their walkers and wheelchairs. We would also love to have volunteers wipe down surfaces in our common areas, chairs, tables, etc. And some closet organization would be super helpful as well!

name: HOPE Community
contactName: Tim Griffith, Nate: Contact Day of
publicDescription: There are two retention ponds on our campus that need to be cleaned up. We also need help with some landscaping: volunteers will pull wees and lay down mulch. Volunteers should wear boots or old sneakers (shoes that can get wet). We can supply gloves and (if requested) plastic eyewear.
bio: The Hope Community ‚Äì Big Bend Homeless Coalition is located in the heart of Tallahassee. The mission is to restore stability and help residents move toward permanent housing through holistic, family-focused support. Family Promise of the Big Bend is powered by people like you. We rely on volunteers to help us with painting and maintenance of our rental units, sorting food, helping us with crafts and other children‚Äôs activities and so much more.

name: Geller Residence
publicDescription: I need help pulling invasive plants and vines.
bio: Leslie Geller is a longtime participant in The Big Event. She lives in a small house with her sweet dog Bubby. She has an expensive backyard that is still suffering from the effects of hurricane Michael. She has a bad knee, so the help is much appreciated.

name: Leon County Sheriff‚Äôs Office
publicDescription: We will be picking up trash around some of the major streets in Tallahassee.
bio: The mission of the Leon County Sheriff‚Äôs Office is to safeguard the lives and property of the people we serve, to reduce the incidence and fear of crime, and to enhance public safety by working in partnership with our diverse community. United in a spirit of teamwork, we are committed to being law enforcement's benchmark for excellence by providing World Class public safety services to the people of Leon County, while maintaining respect for individual rights and human dignity.

name: Crawford Residence
publicDescription: Volunteers will help me rake and bag up leaves.
bio: Miss Crawford is an elderly widow who needs some help cleaning up her yard. She has been living in this residence for over 30 years and has been participating in The Big Event for a while. She‚Äôs very excited to receive help from volunteers.

name: Making Miracles Haven
notes: There is limited parking - requesting volunteers carpool.
publicDescription: There are 3 houses on this property. We need to rake all yards, bag and move the debris to the street. We also need help washing the outside of all windows and cleaning the transport van. Also, we may sort through some of the donated items.
bio: Provide safe, faith-based housing for homeless women who have chosen to embrace motherhood, while nurturing and strengthening them toward independence. To empower moms to live free from bondage and develop generational hope for their children. Our volunteers are an integral part of our program. Touching the lives of these new moms and their babies may be something you feel led to do.

name: The Learning Pavilion
publicDescription: We need help with some indoor painting and window washing.
bio: The Learning Pavilion, formerly known as The Dick Howser Center for Childhood Services, is a smart-play preschool that is dedicated to providing inclusive, high-quality early childhood education for families who live, work, or attend school in the greater Tallahassee Region. Mission: To improve the quality of life and acceptance of children with special needs and their families. Our purpose is to gather resources and support families, minimize the effects of disability through early intervention, increase independence and support participation in life.

name: Hatton Residence
notes: Heavy lifting required. Noted volunteers may come in contact with animals. Also requested attic swept and porch washed.
publicDescription: Volunteers will help with weeding, pruning, and scrubbing / cleaning the bird bath.
bio: She has lived in Tallahassee since 1981 and is now retired. She‚Äôs participating in The Big Event because she needs help with outdoor work around the house, since it is too heavy for her to manage alone. She enjoys bike riding and volunteering at St. Francis.

name: Motivating People through Arts and Crafts
address:
636-6 Railroad Square; Tallahassee, Fl 32310
It is in near Flamingoz Restaurant and the Food Hall.  Behind the open seating area. We have a red heart above our door.
publicDescription: We need help organizing our office space.
bio: MPAC (Motivating People through Arts and Crafts) was founded with the vision to provide a space for everyone, especially persons on the Autism Spectrum, Neurodiverse, and with disabilities to grow and learn career aspirations, social, and life skills. We intend to garner opportunities for financial independence, increase job retention by employing persons with ASD to develop leadership, social, and life skills that reduce anxiety.

name: Bond Elementary School
publicDescription: We need help wiping down students' desks in the classrooms in building 4, cleaning outside windows, raking leaves, and picking up trash around the school.
bio: The mission of Bond Elementary School is to provide learning opportunities that meet the unique needs of our students in a safe, nurturing environment to produce responsible citizens who respect all people. We proudly serve 649 students in grades Pre-Kindergarten through 5th.

name: Nims Middle School
address:
Nims middle school
723 W. Orange Ave
Tallahasse, FL 32310
notes: Outside in the dirt and elements. Requests students with a garden and biology interest.
publicDescription: We need help putting together some garden boxes and revamping the garden area with FAMU garden people. We should have most of the tools, but just need some man or woman power!
bio: R. Frank Nims Middle School is a vibrant learning community where every student is valued, challenged, and supported. Our school is committed to providing a diverse and rigorous curriculum that meets the needs of all learners. From engaging core instruction to enrichment opportunities, our talented and caring educators ensure that every child receives individualized instruction designed to promote academic growth and personal success. Our mission is to nurture a safe, inclusive, and engaging environment where every child is valued, empowered, and inspired to learn. We are dedicated to fostering curiosity, building foundational skills, and encouraging a love for lifelong learning.

name: Goodwood Museum and Gardens
notes: Requested students come dressed in pants with closed-toed shoes.
publicDescription: We need help filling in holes with soil, weeding several garden beds, mulching, and removing invasive plants. Students should come dressed in pants and wearing closed toes shoes.
bio: Goodwood Museum & Gardens, a former plantation, will create a memorial to all people enslaved on the property from approximately 1832 until 1865. A permanent outdoor memorial site has been chosen on a half-acre space adorned with several large live oaks and a bank of azaleas. Volunteers play an important role at Goodwood. Through their various skills and interests, they support existing programs and activities, and provide many services which would not otherwise be available. Becoming a Goodwood volunteer is a rewarding experience, offering personal enrichment, increased knowledge of the property and its collections, and an opportunity to develop new skills and meet fascinating visitors from around the world.

name: Good News Outreach
publicDescription: We need help sorting and organizing food donations at our pantry.
bio: Here at Good News Outreach, we aspire to provide services to those who might not otherwise receive them, whether from other non-profit organizations or governmental agencies. ‚ÄãWe accomplish this mission through our four programs: Food Outreach, Senior Services, Re-entry from Prison, and Affordable Transitional Housing. ‚Äã

name: Pineview Elementary School
notes: Students should be prepared for winter weather and getting dirty.
publicDescription: We will be doing winter garden maintenance. Students should prepare for getting dirty.
bio:
At Pineview, we are rooted in love, unity, and high expectations. In a short time, our students and staff have achieved remarkable growth, earning an A school grade and building a culture where every child is seen, valued, and challenged. Through creativity, collaboration, and strong community partnerships, we continue to rise together. Mission Statement:
All of our students are capable of learning, and for that reason we will not let our students fail!

name: McKenzie Residence
publicDescription: I need help cleaning out closets and a utility room, removing items from overhead shelves, sorting items to donate and keep, and carrying trash to curb. I also need help cleaning out my pantry, checking expiration dates, and moving grocery items to the new pantry cabinet.  If time permits, I will also need help cleaning out the lower level cabinets and replacing the pots and pans.
bio: Teresa McKenzie lives with her sister to help take care of her due to limited mobility. Tallahassee is her home, and she has lived in her house for 35 years. She participated in the Little Event this past fall and needs help decluttering.

name: FAMU Community Garden
address:
301 West Orange AVE
Tallahassee, Florida
Across from FAMU DRS
notes: Come prepared to participate in one of the activities. Bring gloves, hat, water, snack, technology tool with internet access.
publicDescription: We need help building raised garden beds, mulching, clearing garden beds, and planting. If time permits, we would also love some help creating / builidng a social media profile. We would prefer if students come prepared with snacks and water, as it can get hot.
bio: The FAMU Community Garden is the oldest community garden in Tallahassee and one of the oldest in the state. Established over 40 years ago, the garden is located on the southern end of the campus, nestled on three acres of clear fertile land, with 71 plots that are 40 feet long by 40 feet wide. Every year this garden produces in excess of 14 tons of nutritionally rich food, which serves hundreds of families throughout Tallahassee. Every year the FAMU community garden donates thousands of pounds of fresh produce to charitable organizations and involves people in processes that provide food security and alleviate hunger.

name: Seed Time Harvest Farms
publicDescription: Volunteers will assist with farm projects that help secure greenhouse growing. Tasks will also include some general planting
bio: Seed Time Harvest Farms, located in Monticello, Florida, is a CSA (Community Supported Agriculture), composed of many farmers, that identified a community need, assessed that need, and developed a solution that works season after season. When you support Seed Time Harvest Farms, you support a group of local farmers in Madison, Leon, Jefferson, and Gadsden Counties and South Georgia.

name: Great Beginnings Preschool
address:
Great Beginnings Preschool
3840 North Monroe Street 
Suite 400
Tallahassee, FL 32303
(Lake Jackson Town Center - Next to Simply Grace Church)
publicDescription: We would like help cleaning and sanitizing our classrooms and play areas. We would also like help with cleaning the windows and lockers throughout the school.
bio: At A Great Beginning Day Care Center in Tallahassee, children thrive through engaging activities that foster growth in thinking and movement skills. Daily routine includes reading, writing, and group activities. Review of seasons, months, days of week, and letters aids in preparation for Kindergarten. Circle time stimulates communication and peer interactions for social skill development. Arts and crafts projects support creativity and strengthen fine motor skills.

name: Cross Creek Family Resource Center
address: 2002 Old St. Augustine Rd. BLDG A STE 50. Tallahassee FL 32301
publicDescription: The center has a clothing closet and we would love some help sorting the donated clothing. There is also a play area that we nede help cleaning and organizing.
bio: Family Resource Centers use evidence-based strategies to help families build long-term stability and resilience. Family Resource Centers are not just places to get help; they are places to connect, learn, and grow. Our centers empower families with support, not handouts, while encouraging parents to stay engaged, build confidence, and invest in their own success. Together with families, CHS, and our many community partners, we are creating a future where every family has access to the support they need‚Äîbecause strong families build strong communities.

name: Howard Residence
notes: Have gloves
publicDescription: I need help with some general gardening, including pulling weeds and cutting small plants.
bio: Miss Howard is an elderly woman who needs help with some yardwork. The Big Event is very important to her because she is physically unable to do the work herself. She has been involved for a while now and looks forward to it every year.

name: Griffin Heights Children & Families Resource Center
notes: Yes, the building is in the Springfield apartments. Once you enter the complex pass mailboxes and make a right at the 1st round about then right at the dead end and you will see a brown building in 2nd round about.
publicDescription: Griffin Heights Children & Families Resource Center is requesting assistance with organizing the Angel Closet and sanitizing / cleaning inside the building.
bio: The Griffin Heights Children and Families Resource Center (GHCFRC/Center) seeks to reduce barriers and provide a bridge for residents to access needed services that will help to address health and safety disparities.

name: Elder Care Services
address: Elder Care Services, 2518 W. Tennessee Street, Tallahassee FL 32303
notes: Dress to get dirty
publicDescription: We have three cargo vans that we would like to have swept out, the interior wiped down, and vacuumed. We alos need help with cleaning out our shed (moving stuff around). Please come dressed ready to get dirty.
bio: For over 54 years, Elder Care Services has been fulfilling our mission to improve the quality of life for seniors and their caregivers in the Big Bend. Our comprehensive services provide community based, compassionate care for a broad spectrum of seniors. For active seniors, we provide an avenue to stay engaged in the community through volunteering placement. For families beginning the aging process, we are an advocate and trusted resource. For frail and homebound seniors, we continue to provide a variety of services that promote independence and safety while individuals age in place.

name: Summerlin Residence
notes: Bring gloves and masks if you want to wear them
publicDescription: I need help cleaning my back porch (rearranging the plants on the patio, maybe putting down fabric to keep weeds from growing, etc.). I also need help cleaning around the perimeter of my house and organizing my linen closet if time permits.

name: Women Empowering Eachother / WEE Diaper Bank
notes: Heavy lifting involved
publicDescription: We need assistance with office organization, community outreach (which could be done within the community if possible and/or over the phone), diaper wrapping and donation sorting. Please note some heavy lifting may be involved.
bio: At WEE Diaper Bank, we are committed to addressing diaper needs, a critical issue affecting 1 in 2 U.S. families. Our mission is to provide essential diaper supplies to low-income families and empower them to achieve stability and self-sufficiency. We believe that every child deserves the comfort and security of a clean diaper, and we strive to make this a reality for families in our community. We provide diapers to families in need through our network of partner organizations and direct outreach, allowing us to distribute thousands of diapers each month with your support. In addition to providing diapers, we offer educational resources and referrals to further support services, helping families build a more stable and secure future. We also actively raise awareness about diaper needs and advocate for policies that support low-income families and address diaper insecurity.

name: Mendenhall Building A, Florida State University
address: Mendenhall Building A next to Einstein bagels. 969 Learning Way, Tallahassee, FL 32304
publicDescription: We need help picking up trash around FSU campus.
bio: Mendenhall Building A is requesting students to help clean up trash around FSU's campus. Students will assist in keeping FSU a clean and beautiful campus!

name: Domi Station
publicDescription: We need help archiving files.
bio: "We‚Äôre Building a startup community, and you can get involved." Domi is a non-profit coworking space and community hub for small businesses and entrepreneurs. We offer programs, resources, and events that help entrepreneurs start and scale sustainable companies. In a time when progress demands innovation, we believe startups are the way forward.

name: Boys Town North Florida
address: 2752 Hollyhock Hill Tallahassee, FL 32303. This is a group home for foster children on the Boys Town Campus. Enter from Hartsfield Road. Park anywhere on the grass
notes: Boys Town has a volunteer dress code policy- Shorts must touch the tips of fingers, no leggings or yoga pants, all tops must have cap sleeves, spaghetti straps are not permitted. Chest, backside and torso must be covered. Clothing should not depict violence, guns, sexuality, foul language, political or social statements, tobacco, drugs, and alcohol.
publicDescription: We need help mulching flower beds, planting plants, trimming hedges, pressure washing cement decks, picking up debris, and washing windows at our foster children group home.
bio: ‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄãThe first of Boys Town‚Äôs national sites, Boys Town North Florida has been serving children and families since 1983. We partner with area agencies and businesses to constantly enhance the quality and variety of care we provide in the community. Every year, our Continuum of Care¬Æ services touch the lives of more than 5,000 people in North Florida. Boys Town has a long history of serving as an excellent steward of our donor support. Charity Navigator, one of the nation‚Äôs largest and most-respected charity rating systems, has awarded Boys Town its highest rating for the sound management of its ‚Äãfinances. We are very strongly positioned to continue to save children and heal families in North Florida.

name: Levine Residence
tasks: Gardening/Landscaping,Washing Windows,Raking and bagging leaves and sweeping
notes: Bring gloves,gallon trash bags,rakes
publicDescription: We need help raking leaves in the front yard, backyard, and side yards. We also need assistance with washing the outside windows around the house.
bio: Levine has lived in Tallahassee for about 18 years and attended FSU in the past. She loves traveling, playing pickleball, and fishing. She has been to every state except one. She is currently retired and has started a business in Tallahassee called ‚ÄúHere to Help.‚Äù She needs help around her house because she is too old to do yard work.

name: Apalache Ridge tech center
notes: Just be friendly
publicDescription: Volunteers will be surveying neighbors to update contact information and announce upcoming neighborhood meetings.
bio: The Apalachee Ridge Technology & Learning Center is a community-focused "Tech Hub" designed to bridge the digital divide for many residents. The center works with the Greater Apalachee Ridge Estates Neighborhood Association, Comcast, Leon County Schools, and local Rotary Clubs to provide internet access, technology training, and,, in partnership with other initiatives,, refurbished computers to economically vulnerable residents and students.

name: Unity Eastside Church/Into The Woods Playschool
notes: Volunteers will be in the woods in nature. They should dress appropriately, wear bug spray, and bring gloves and shovels if possible.
publicDescription: Volunteers will be working in the woods to remove invasive plant species. They will be hand pulling and digging out the plants. We ask students to dress appropriately for being outdoors and to bring bug spray if possible.
bio: Into the woods playschool is Tallahassee‚Äôs first forest school. We believe that children, especially those between the ages of 3 and 5, learn best through direct experience with the natural world. We give children the time and space to do their work which is PLAY! In return, nature will work on your children physically, emotionally, and intellectually. Our curriculum is child-led and hands on. Children will explore, take risks, build, make observations‚Ä¶.and along the way they will build strong relationships which each other and the earth, develop a passion for learning and gain skills necessary to get them ready for the years of schooling ahead of them.

name: Redemptive Love Farm and Rescue
tasks: Gardening/Landscaping,Trash Cleanup,Outdoor projects on the farm
notes: Come in clothes you dont mind getting dirty. Be prepared to get your hands dirty!
publicDescription: We need some help cleaning our animal rescue facility and working on outdoor work around the farm (moving logs, cleaning the farm, help create our butterfly gardens, etc.). Please wear clothes you don't mind getting dirty.
bio: Redemptive Love Rescue is a 501c3 non-profit, volunteer-run, community-funded and board-managed organization! Our volunteers are passionate about helping people facing hardships by caring for their farm animals & finding homes for rescued livestock! We seek to spread love and joy by providing animal therapy and teaching our next generation to be compassionate towards both people and animals!

name: 621 Gallery
tasks: Washing Windows,Indoor/Outdoor Painting (note: The Big Event Tallahassee does not provide paint),Trash Cleanup,Cleaning/display reset of gift shop, general cleaning reorganization of storage
notes: we are not temperature controlled, so dress for the temp outside, and dress in clothes you don't mind getting dirty or paint on them, daddy long leg spider webs will be part of the cleaning (in case students are afraid of spiders)
publicDescription: We have 2 small bathrooms that need repainting and we need the cleaning station between the restrooms to be reorganized. We also have a new gift shop layout we could use help setting up (potentially painting, arranging new displays, etc.). We are not temperature controlled, so please dress accordingly.
bio: 621 Gallery is the oldest contemporary art gallery in Tallahassee, Florida. Located right between FAMU and FSU, 621 is a part of the Railroad Square Arts District. We provide an environment for community and art to come together and be apart of something larger than themselves. We start each month with First Friday, a gallery hop started by 621 Gallery in the early 2000s. Throughout the month we have an array of programs and events ranging from art auctions to concerts to fashion shows.

name: Grassroots Free School
publicDescription: We need assistance clearing and preparing our garden spaces, cleaning up the playground area, and cleaning the outside of the buildings.
bio: At Grassroots, students pursue their own educational journey in a supportive and nurturing environment. The school‚Äôs philosophy is based on the twin principles of self-regulation on the individual level and self-government on the community level. Every day at Grassroots is unlike the day before (and of course, students have the freedom to make their own educational choices).

name: Tallahassee Trust for Historic Preservation
publicDescription: We need help with leaf removal and waster removal in our front and side lawn. This should require 4-5 volunteers. We also have an historic book library and archive surrounding Florida's and Tallahassee's history. We could use some volunteers to help us organize, inventory, and find new homes for the new materials!
bio: The Tallahassee Trust for Historic Preservation is dedicated to protecting and celebrating the architectural,   cultural, and environmental heritage that makes our city   unique. As both the official Tallahassee-Leon County   Architectural Review Board (ARB) and a community-   focused nonprofit, we serve a dual mission: regulatory stewardship and community connection. Regulatory stewardship oversees designs and standards for historic properties, ensuring  thoughtful preservation through the Certificate of  Appropriateness (COA) process and local landmark designations. Community connection, through educational programs, guided tours, and advocacy, helps residents  and visitors discover Tallahassee‚Äôs stories, from iconic landmarks to hidden neighborhood gems.

name: Miccosukee Hills Condominiums
address: 1636 Miccosukee Loop, Tallahassee Florida. 32308 (make sure to go past the sign that says "Cottages of Miccosukee"
tasks: Gardening/Landscaping,Washing Windows,Indoor/Outdoor Painting (note: The Big Event Tallahassee does not provide paint),Trash Cleanup
notes: The volunteers hard work will do more than just clean a window or pull a weed‚Äîit provides us with a brighter view from our windows, and the joy of seeing their energy in our neighborhood.
publicDescription:
Our community consists of 16 duplexes housing 38 residents who take great pride in our neighborhood. The majority of our residents are over the age of 65, and many live with limited mobility or chronic health issues. These physical constraints make routine outdoor maintenance‚Äîand tasks requiring reaching or bending‚Äîa significant challenge.To maximize the students' time, we have identified the following high-impact tasks:
* Outside Window Washing: Cleaning ground-level exterior windows to improve natural light and visibility for our residents. (This is a high-need task as our residents can no longer safely use ladders or reach high spots).
* Debris Removal: Raking leaves in the small front and backyards.
* Garden Care: Weeding flower beds and spreading light mulch/ pine straw to prevent regrowth.
* Exterior Brightening: Wiping down front-porch railings and outdoor seating areas.
bio: Miccosukee Hills Condominiums functions as a 106-unit community for seniors (62+) or individuals with disabilities, focusing on providing a "welcoming environment designed to support both independence and relaxation" in a quiet, accessible setting. The community emphasizes modern, comfortable living.

name: Hebert Residence
notes: Drive can only park three cars; would like same group as last year
publicDescription: I need help organizing my outdoor shed. Please note my driveway can only park three cars.
bio: She is participating in The Big Event because she believes it is a great way for students to get out into the community, meet new people, and share their talents. She enjoys knitting and crocheting. The Big Event has been important to her for the past 10 years.

name: Ivy Residence
publicDescription: I need help going through the things in my garage and organizing it!
bio: This is a retired elderly couple who have lived in Tallahassee since 2001, originally residing in Wisconsin. She is retired and has a deep appreciation for community service. Both she and her husband are ministers who are actively involved in their church and community. In her free time, she enjoys fishing and spending time by the water.

name: iGrow Garden
notes: Dress for gardening
publicDescription: Volunteers will be assisting in planting, organizing shed, mulching garden, etc. Please dress appropriately for gardening.
bio: iGrow ‚ÄúWhatever You Like‚Äù is an urban agriculture and youth empowerment program focused on growing healthy food for the community while providing youth employment and leadership development. This young group of leaders, entrepreneurs, and activists is committed to enhancing Tallahassee‚Äôs food environment. Our mission is to grow community-based good food systems that provide healthy, affordable food for all. Our vision is an educated world that has access to food that is healthy, green, fair, accessible, and affordable.

name: Abellera Residence
notes: Heavy lifting + contact with animals. The property is adjacent to an unincorporated mixed hardwood forest. As there is no bounding fence, wildlife is free to roam to and from the property. The biggest concern is that there may be hibernating snakes under rocks or stones. Snakes will flee from the area if there is a good amount of human activity. As this is Florida, other insects and organisms will be present on the property including ticks, mosquitoes, wasps, and spiders. Closed toe shoes is mandatory. Long socks, long pants, breathable long sleeve shirt, and work gloves will reduce the chance of bites and stings from these organisms. Eye protection can be available for working in wooded areas to avoid pokes from eye-level branches. I can provide bottles of water and packaged snacks for volunteers.
publicDescription:
I will need help manually clearing invasive plants from the property; some small trees will need to be dug up as well as plenty of small herbaceous plants. It is important to extract the invasive plant entirely, roots and all, to ensure the plant does not come back. Volunteers can choose from an assortment of hand tools to weed and dig up roots.
Larger invasive plants to be removed will be marked with pink paint on the trunks. Sensitive areas will be marked by a bright orange flag. These areas with flags have plants that do not need to be removed. Before work starts, the homeowner will conduct a walk-though of the property to point out the different types of invasive plants. Trash bags will be provided to contain the plants so they may be disposed properly. Other activities may include moving yard debris, digging holes, raking and/or sweeping.
bio: Richie, with his wife and 2 kids, live in a small neighborhood right near Campbell Park. Richie has lived in this area since he was a child. Although the house is small, there is a big, densely wooded area that needs some maintenance.

name: Rowan Residence
notes: Contact with animals
publicDescription: I need help washing the outside of the my house's windows. I have a dog, so please be wary of allergies.
bio: Tom and his wife are an elderly couple that need some help cleaning the windows of their home. They are very passionate about their home and their sweet dog!

name: Johnston Residence
notes: Heavy lifting  + Contact with Animals. I do have an electric mower and not many gardening tools
publicDescription: I need help raking and bagging up leaves, removing old debris, sorting through things in the garage and throwing away trash. I also need help washing the outside of my windows.

name: Unitarian Universalist Church of Tallahassee
address: Unitarian Universalist Church of Tallahassee, 2810 N. Meridian Rd, Tall, FL 32312
notes: We will provide snacks for the volunteers
publicDescription: We need help taking all items out of playground, cleaning, and then painting the items. We also want to clear any debris in playground and add new mulch. Lastly, we want to trim any overhanging vegetation and remove invasive plants near the playgrounds. We will provide snacks for the volunteers!
bio: Unitarian Universalist Church of Tallahassee - We are a church which holds Love as the foundation of our Beloved Community. Thus, we are diverse in faith, ethnicity, lifestyle, and history. Yet we come together to welcome and support each other in leading lives aligned with our principles and in representing these principles in the world. Our mission: "Inspiring all to seek freely, to live ethically, to nurture each other and the Earth."

name: Sisters Mentoring Sisters, The Lori Page Center
notes: NA
publicDescription: We need help cleaning the second building, removing debris from the property, and possibly fixing a fence.
bio: Sisters Mentoring Sisters, The Lori Page Center aims to empower girls and youth who identify with female development by providing a safe, supportive space where they can build confidence, strengthen relationships, and develop the skills needed to thrive emotionally, socially, and personally.

name: Louise B. Royal
publicDescription: We need help with raking leaves off the ground/playground area and planting new flowers. Please come dressed for gardening work.
bio: All children can succeed if given the proper tools to learn and develop in a healthy way. By providing them with a variety of educational experiences in all domains of learning, we foster cognitive development as well as creativity and self-expression. Thus, it is our mission that children and families become self-sufficient through the provision of comprehensive services that empower them, socially, emotionally, economically, and physically.

name: BuddBell Early Learning Center
publicDescription: We are hoping to have our playground cleaned up as well as our mural finished and another mural created for the children to see. We also need help organizing and cleaning our resource rooms.
bio: Budd Bell is an Early Head Start center operated by Kids Incorporated of the Big Bend. Kids Incorporated supports and educates families with young children through quality early learning, health and family services so that they can reach their full potential. Why does early learning matter? Research has shown that: the critical window for emotional development occurs between birth and 18 months of age, most of a person‚Äôs vocabulary is formed by age 3, neurological foundations for math and logic are formed by age 4, etc. Thus, we aim to equip families to learn and grow together so every child can reach their full potential

name: Tallahassee Museum
notes: Might be working in a tight space from time to time
publicDescription: The Tallahassee Museum runs camps throughout the year for kids. In preparation for summer camp, volunteers will help sort through our craft supplies and assist in organizing our craft closet.
bio: Tallahassee Museum is a unique place with an equally unique mission ‚Äî to inspire people to transform their lives, community and the world through an enhanced understanding of our region‚Äôs natural and cultural environments. Our 52-acre size and beautiful location along Lake Bradford afford us the opportunity to take our guests‚Äô learning outside the four walls of a typical museum and into nature itself. Here, the past intersects with the present, giving us a glimpse of the future that cen be if we come together to make it so.

name: Hoffmann Residence
notes: I will provide tools to do the job.
publicDescription: I need help cutting some overgrown branches and replacing some wooden boards on my fence.

name: McCaskill Residence
tasks: Gardening/Landscaping,Trash Cleanup,Other (cutting hedges with manual hedge clippers)
notes: Please come in the morning. I have a conflict at 2 p.m. - 3 p.m. No restrooms available
publicDescription: I need help raking and bagging leaves from my backyard and taking any debris/trash from the backyard to the curb for pick up day. I also need help cutting hedges with manual hedge clippers.

name: Nelson Residence
tasks: Gardening/Landscaping,Washing Windows, maybe painting stairs if enough time
publicDescription: I need help with yard clean up (removing leaves, trimming hedges and bushes, edging, defining flower beds and mulching). Please come dressed for outside work.
bio: A Minnesota native, she has lived in Tallahassee since the 1960s and is now retired. She does not have any children or family members living locally. She chose to participate in The Big Event because she appreciates programs that support the community and because she needs help herself. She once worked for the state and is a graduate of both UF and FSU, with a career as an attorney in the legislature. She has lived in Southwood for the past 23 years and loves dogs and horses.

name: Hayes Residence
notes: Preferably group of girls
publicDescription: I need help organizing my work space.
bio: Dr. Hayes is an older lady recovering from a traumatic brain injury. She spends a lot of her time making aromatherapy concoctions that she needs help organizing.

name: Forest Edge Neighborhood
notes: Lunch will be provided.
publicDescription: Volunteers will assist in picking up roadside litter from neighborhood roads, a park, and near a lake.
bio: Forest Edge is a quiet neighborhood (not HOA) that has a lot of trash left in their park, on the roads, and a camp

name: Magnolia Preschool
notes: They should dress accordingly to help with landscaping.
publicDescription: We need help with basic landscaping around the building. Please make sure to dress accordingly for the outside weather.
bio: Located in the heart of sunny Tallahassee, Florida, Magnolia Preschool is dedicated to helping children flourish in an innovative, educational, and social environment. Our veteran-owned business serves children from infancy through age 5, providing care and education tailored to each developmental stage.

name: Astoria Park Elementary
publicDescription: We need help cleaning our exterior windows and landscaping the outside. We also need help cleaning a storage building.
bio: At Astoria Park Elementary School, love and care for our students are at the heart of everything we do. Our dedicated teachers deliver high-quality instruction every day, ensuring every child is challenged, supported, and inspired. Staff and faculty consistently go above and beyond, whether in the classroom, on the playground, or through community engagement. We believe in building strong, positive relationships that nurture confidence, character, and lifelong learning. As proud Astoria Park Panthers, our students are empowered to succeed not just in school, but in life. That‚Äôs why we say: You WIN With Us, or You Watch Us WIN! Because, at Astoria Park, winning means growing, thriving, and leading with heart.

name: The Salvation Army of Tallahassee
publicDescription: We need help cleaning and sorting donations in the Family Thrift Store. We also need help placing donated items on the sales floor.
bio: The Salvation Army is dedicated to offering a comprehensive array of traditional social services and emergency assistance programs to support individuals and families in need. These services are designed to address various challenges and provide essential aid during difficult times. "Doing The Most Good." In these four words, our mission - to feed, to clothe, to comfort, to care. To rebuild broken homes and broken lives. By walking with the addicted, we can lead them to recovery. In fighting hunger and poverty, we can feed and nurture the spirit. And, in living and sharing the Christian Gospel by meeting tangible needs, we give the world a lasting display of the love behind our beliefs.

name: Joseph House
notes: We have two houses next door to each other.
publicDescription: We need help cleaning up flower beds, lawn care, raking, cleaning porches, and touch up painting of disabled ramp and railings.
bio: Florida‚Äôs incarceration rate exceeds every country on the planet. In this era of mass incarceration, when millions are warehoused in prisons and jails, the dignity of the human person is compromised. In a process Joseph House calls accompaniment, we prioritize the material, relational, and spiritual needs of the human person by walking with them as friends and advocates as they rejoin us in free society. Our approach understands the past, recognizes the trauma of the prisoner, and strives for truth and reconciliation.

name: Alfred B. Maclay Gardens State Park
notes:
This project may require volunteers to leave the footpath to access the Coral ardisia plants, potentially exposing them to harmful plants (ex: poison ivy) and biting insects (ex: ticks). 
We recommend all participants wear long pants and bring a water bottle. Closed-toe shoes are required. Gloves and insect repellant will be provided, but feel free to bring your own.
Participants can expect to walk a minimum of 2 miles over the course of the project, potentially up to 4 miles. *Tell Ranger Station Attendant you're there for The Big Event to be directed to work site
publicDescription: Volunteers will hike the Lake Overstreet trail and manually pull invasive Coral ardisia plants. We recommend all participants wear long pants and bring a water bottle.
bio: The Maclay Gardens area  masterpiece of floral architecture, featuring a picturesque brick pathway, a secret garden, a reflection pool, a walled garden, and hundreds of camellias and azaleas. In 1923, Alfred Maclay visited Tallahassee and was impressed by the huge oaks and pines, beautiful dogwoods and hollies. He decided this would be the place to fulfill his lifelong dream of creating a beautiful garden. In 1953, nine years after Mr. Maclay‚Äôs death, Mrs. Maclay and her children donated the gardens to the state of Florida. She expressed her wishes that the gardens always be maintained as a memorial to her husband and his creation, and opened to the public for the enjoyment of the people of Florida and guests.

name: Sunshine Neighborhood - Ridge Road
notes: The trash is sort of scattered around the neighborhood.
publicDescription: We need help picking up trash along the roads in the neighborhood.

name: Callen Neighborhood
address: Corners of Lake Bradford and Coleman Street; and Pottssamer Street and Callen Street
notes: This is a neighborhood street cleanup project for the historic Callen Neighborhood.
publicDescription: We need help cleaning our streets and collecting any debris within the neighborhood.
bio: Callen Neighborhood is a historically Black neighborhood and honors the influence and legacy of important Black homeowners in Tallahassee.

name: Griffin Middle School
publicDescription: We need assistance with mulching, planting flowers, and cleaning the parking lot.
bio: Griffin Middle School empowers students through rigorous and relevant teaching and learning to develop the skills, knowledge, and character necessary to become successful, engaged, and responsible global citizens. All Griffin Middle School, students will utilize various forms of technology to apply and expand skills, explore careers, and successfully transition to high school as productive citizens of society who are on track for technical careers, college, and/or the workforce.

name: Settlers Creek Addition-Home Owners Association (HOA)
address: Settlers Creek Addition HOA (One entrance sign says Settlers Creek Addition A Townhome Community. The other entrance says Settlers Creek Addition) Please note that there is another community directly after ours that also says Settlers Creek Addition). Therefore, it may be best to put in 3118 Hotchkiss Lane, Tallahassee, FL. 32303 and it is okay to meet at that address on site.
publicDescription: We have elders in our community that would appreciate having their leaves raked and any weeds pulled from their property and from the sidewalks. A few homeowners may want assistance with other landscaping services as applicable. My name is Kimberly Davis and I can be reached at (404) 787-8511.

name: Dasher Residence
publicDescription: I need help raking and bagging leaves and other debris.
bio: She has lived in Tallahassee since 1967 and is retired at home with her husband. She loves to volunteer part-time at her church, and they both stay continuously involved in their church community.

name: Maryland Oaks
publicDescription: The volunteers will be outside raking and bagging the leaves in the playground area.
bio: Good News Outreach has many arms reaching out into the community. Food Bank, Senior Food Delivery, Senior Living, Men and Women‚Äôs re-entry program and more. Maryland Oaks Crossing Community is one of the more‚Äôs Maryland Oaks is affordable housing for families. The objective here at Maryland Oaks is to help families re establish themselves. Our on site Learning Center is used to tutor kids after school on Thursdays. Help families with budget training, with resume for job placement, provide a safe environment for moms and kids. There are several community participants that partner with Good News here at Maryland Oaks setting up events. Teaching kids proper hygiene, wellness checks for families. Movie night and much more. Maryland Oaks is a community that appreciates their home and takes pride in their clean atmosphere.

name: Sherwood Park Neighborhood Association
notes: We have two entrances to our community, Ridge Rd. and Sunnyside Dr,. Also Ridge Rd and Toucan St.
publicDescription: We need assistance planting flowers at the entrance of our neighborhood and neighborhood cleanup.We basically need help beautifying our neighborhood entrance with plants, flowers, as well as cleanup.
bio: A neighborhood in Tallahassee that needs assistance with cleanup and with planting flowers at their entrance.

name: Project Annie Inc.
tasks: Gardening/Landscaping,Washing Windows,Indoor/Outdoor Painting (note: The Big Event Tallahassee does not provide paint),Trash Cleanup
notes: Just be prepared to work. We really need the help. Thank you so much.
publicDescription: We need help cleaning our facility for future use.
bio: Since 2008, Project Annie has been the heart of Frenchtown providing quality childcare, nourishing meals, and hope to families throughout Tallahassee. ‚ÄúHelping Children/Adults to Help Themselves.‚Äù Project Annie provides quality, affordable childcare and early education that empowers families in the Frenchtown community to pursue their goals while ensuring their children receive the care and development they deserve.

name: Ortiz Residence
tasks: Gardening/Landscaping,Indoor/Outdoor Painting (note: The Big Event Tallahassee does not provide paint)
publicDescription: We need help cutting down dead plants/landscaping on the side of our house and moving any debris to side of the road for pick up by city. We also need help washing doors, awnings, and windows and painting, if necessary.
